content:
• Wednesday, July 11, 2012
  • MRK

    Merck (NYSE:MRK) +3% AH after reporting favorable Phase III trial results for its odnacatib...

    Merck (NYSE:MRK) +3% AH after reporting favorable Phase III trial results for its odnacatib osteoporosis drug. The company says it will "begin taking steps to close the trial," and plans to submit the drug for approval by U.S., E.U., and Japanese regulators in 1H 2013. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • SVU

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): Q1 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.19. Revenue of $10.6B (-4.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    SuperValu (NYSE:SVU): Q1 EPS of $0.19 misses by $0.19. Revenue of $10.6B (-4.5% Y/Y) misses by $200M. Shares -19.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN) -5.2% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size....

    ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN) -5.2% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. ImmunoGen, whose shares made new highs on Tuesday, has been bleeding cash as it works to bring its cancer drugs to market. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • CALX

    Calix (CALX -10.2%) falls 23.8% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $79M and EPS of $0.04,...

    Calix (CALX -10.2%) falls 23.8% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $79M and EPS of $0.04, far below a consensus of $95.1M and $0.10. The broadband infrastructure provider, already hit hard by Adtran's Q2 report, blames weak service provider capex in multiple markets. The capex cuts, in turn, are blamed on macro issues and regulatory uncertainty. UBS' call on telecom capex is looking quite accurate at this point.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q1 EPS of -$0.35 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $13M (+18.2% Y/Y) beats...

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q1 EPS of -$0.35 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $13M (+18.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.3M. Shares -8.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • GES

    A number of denim makers were roughed up a bit in trading today after privately-held Levi...

    A number of denim makers were roughed up a bit in trading today after privately-held Levi Strauss reported sluggish earnings for Q2. The company's 38% Y/Y drop in profits was impacted by high cotton prices and a strong dollar. Decliners: GES -1.9%, TRLG -5.9%, GPS -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • JCP

    S&P does its best to put in a bottom for J.C. Penney (JCP -2.6%) cutting it to B+ with...

    S&P does its best to put in a bottom for J.C. Penney (JCP -2.6%) cutting it to B+ with negative outlook from BB- . "J.C. Penney remains weak, resulting in a meaningful deterioration of credit protection metrics ... the new pricing and merchandise strategy will cause further disruptions to operations." The stock hit a 2-year low today.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • WM

    Waste Management (WM -5.9%) continues lower following a downgrade to Underweight from Morgan...

    Waste Management (WM -5.9%) continues lower following a downgrade to Underweight from Morgan Stanley's Vance Edelson. Buy Republic Services (NYSE:RSG) instead, he says. It's cheaper, buying back more of its shares, and is entangled with fewer "non-core distractions."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -5.9%) dives below $8 for the first time after Citi's Mark Mahaney cuts his...

    Groupon (GRPN -5.9%) dives below $8 for the first time after Citi's Mark Mahaney cuts his estimates on concerns about European sales, which account for 25% of Groupon's revenue. Mahaney now expects Groupon to post 2013 EBITDA of $718M, down from a prior $930M. The company's Q2 report is expected to arrive around month's end. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoor (DECK +3.1%) take a turn north with the typical cries of short squeeze getting...

    Deckers Outdoor (DECK +3.1%) take a turn north with the typical cries of short squeeze getting bandied about by short term traders. While shorts do control much of the action on DECK, another underlying factor for the stock is that sheepskin prices have moved dramatically lower, which in turn could help the UGG boot maker down the road.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -5.6%) adds to the big losses seen yesterday on account of a very critical Citron...

    Questcor (QCOR -5.6%) adds to the big losses seen yesterday on account of a very critical Citron Research report, even as more analysts rush to the drug developer's defense. Jefferies declares Citron's complaints to be a re-hashing of old arguments, and thinks any generic alternatives to Questcor's Acthar would be both inferior and take years to commercialize. Oppenheimer presents a similar take.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -7.2%) nears its 52-week low after BofA downgrades shares to Underperform, and...

    Dendreon (DNDN -7.2%) nears its 52-week low after BofA downgrades shares to Underperform, and lowers its PT to $6 from $13. The firm expects Provenge sales to fall short of expectations for the next several quarters, keeping the business in the red, and that such a weak demand environment will limit the valuation an acquirer is willing to pay.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU -7.4%) and Tudou (TUDO -9.8%) crash after it's learned Tudou COO Evelyn Wang has...

    Youku.com (YOKU -7.4%) and Tudou (TUDO -9.8%) crash after it's learned Tudou COO Evelyn Wang has resigned, supposedly to "pursue personal development opportunities elsewhere." Tudou asserts the resignation won't affect its planned merger with Youku, which stands to create a Chinese online video behemoth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • PALDF

    North American Palladium (PAL -11.1%) dives to multi-year lows after announcing a C$43M ($42.2M)...

    North American Palladium (PAL -11.1%) dives to multi-year lows after announcing a C$43M ($42.2M) convertible debt offering, and getting downgraded to Neutral by Credit Suisse in the aftermath. The debt matures in Sep. 2017, carries a yield of 6.15%, and features a conversion price of C$2.90/share, 57% above PAL's current price on the Toronto exchange. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPTT

    Microcap Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +62.5%) skyrockets after reaching a deal with Lockheed...

    Microcap Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +62.5%) skyrockets after reaching a deal with Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) to develop a 19MW wave-energy project off the coast of Australia. The project will make use of OPTT's PowerBuoy device and Lockheed's wave-energy converters. A $65M grant from the Australian government will help finance the effort. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • WEN

    This isn't your grandparents' Wendy's (WEN +2.4%) anymore. After maintaining a rather stoic...

    This isn't your grandparents' Wendy's (WEN +2.4%) anymore. After maintaining a rather stoic image over the years, the restaurant chain is undergoing a major transformation with lounge seating, flat-screen TVs, Wi-Fi, and digital menu boards all part of the new look. Part of the logic behind the shift is the data suggesting dine-in eaters spend more than drive-through customers. Earlier: (Wedbush upgrade lifts shares)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment

  • Report buyers get burned as corn moves 1.3% lower on the day, a full $0.40 off the level hit in...

    Report buyers get burned as corn moves 1.3% lower on the day, a full $0.40 off the level hit in the minutes after the USDA confirmed what everyone has known for weeks - the harsh weather is hurting the crop. Beans and wheat remain higher, but also sharply off post-report levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 12 Comments
  • DF

    Dean Foods (DF -6.2%) sells off on above-normal volume after shares etched out a two-year high...

    Dean Foods (DF -6.2%) sells off on above-normal volume after shares etched out a two-year high yesterday. Investors could be heading for the safety of the sidelines with the firm's Q2 earnings report around the corner or projections for higher milk prices from the USDA could be tipping sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • ERF

    Enerplus (ERF +4.7%) bounces after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse, The...

    Enerplus (ERF +4.7%) bounces after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from Credit Suisse, The firm is lowering its estimates for the Canadian oil and gas producer on account of falling prices, but its PT of $21 is 63% above current levels. Enerplus has had a rough 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • GG

    The GDX slides 1.7% following Goldcorp's (GG -8.5%) cut in production guidance. Other miners:...

    The GDX slides 1.7% following Goldcorp's (GG -8.5%) cut in production guidance. Other miners: Yamana (AUY -1.5%, Kincross (KGC -0.9%, Agnico-Eagle (AEM -0.7%), Newmont (NEM -1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 3 Comments
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -14.3%) plunges after reporting Q2 revenue of $184M (down slightly Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Adtran (ADTN -14.3%) plunges after reporting Q2 revenue of $184M (down slightly Y/Y) and EPS of $0.38; the latter beat by $0.03, but the former missed by $6.2M. Much like Acme Packet, Adtran blames a tough telecom capex environment for its woes. The company is guiding for Q3 revenue to be flat to slightly up Q/Q (consensus is for a 20% increase), and says poor visibility leaves it cautious about the near-term. Down in sympathy: CIEN -7%. CALX -6.4%. TLAB -1.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • SKYW

    SkyWest (SKYW +14.1%) trades higher after Raymond James ups its rating on shares to Outperform...

    SkyWest (SKYW +14.1%) trades higher after Raymond James ups its rating on shares to Outperform from Perform. The upgrade follows a broader theme in the sector of the Wall Street analysts latching onto regional carriers in favor of the big names.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.5%) says it will decide within months whether it will build a 700MW...

    Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.5%) says it will decide within months whether it will build a 700MW Chinese solar cell plant. CSIQ has a heavy debt load, and industry conditions makes this a less-than-ideal time for such an investment, but CSIQ is hoping the high efficiency of the cells it plans to produce will justify the outlay. Also, the Chinese government has been generous in supporting local manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • ARNA

    Jim Cramer dampens some of the excitement surrounding Arena (ARNA -4.1%), saying that the...

    Jim Cramer dampens some of the excitement surrounding Arena (ARNA -4.1%), saying that the company's Belviq diet drug won't make as much money as people think. Cramer notes that Arena will receive just 40% of the revenues from treatment, which is anyway not as effective as initially thought, nor as good as Vivus' (NASDAQ:VVUS) yet-to-be-approved Qnexa.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 25 Comments
  • OCZ

    Investors show no mercy to OCZ Technology (OCZ -17.5%) for its FQ1 miss. The fact rivals STEC...

    Investors show no mercy to OCZ Technology (OCZ -17.5%) for its FQ1 miss. The fact rivals STEC (STEC +2.5%) and Fusion-io (FIO +1.8%) are up suggests the Street thinks OCZ's problems are company-specific. FBN is downgrading OCZ, and doesn't think the company's explanation for the miss (a power regulator shortage) tells the whole story. Credit Suisse is also downgrading, citing worries about cash burn and a slow ramp for PCI Express hardware. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson (HOG -4.1%) falters a bit after Citigroup comes out with a note forecasting the...

    Harley-Davidson (HOG -4.1%) falters a bit after Citigroup comes out with a note forecasting the company's motorcycle sales may have slowed down in June. Though Q2 sales growth is now estimated to be in a 4%-5% range, compared to the stellar 26% pace in Q1, the up-and-down nature of motorcycle sales has analysts keeping a bullish tone on the name for now.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • IP

    Shares of International Paper (IP +3.6%) trade higher after a merger in the industry between two...

    Shares of International Paper (IP +3.6%) trade higher after a merger in the industry between two global companies went off at a healthy premium.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • SCLN

    SA author The GeoTeam argues that SciClone (NASDAQ:SCLN) faces risks that should see it trade at...

    SA author The GeoTeam argues that SciClone (NASDAQ:SCLN) faces risks that should see it trade at $2.65-$3.80. These include: the failure of the firm's Zadaxin drug, its lead product, in multiple Phase III studies for various uses; probable price reductions in China, SciClone's main source of revenue; and an SEC investigation into bribery in the country. Shares -5.4% to $6.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ANF

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (ANF +5.4%) plans (previous): Sources say the buyback will be a...

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (ANF +5.4%) plans (previous): Sources say the buyback will be a "material increase" over the retailer's current 12.9M shares. As for Europe, CEO Mike Jeffries is considering moving away from a previous plan to expand aggressively on the continent with consumer demand remaining weak.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) move up 5.2% premarket with a report out saying the...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) move up 5.2% premarket with a report out saying the retailer plans to make a big buyback and scale back in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are flat-to-higher after the trade deficit hits expectations and...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat-to-higher after the trade deficit hits expectations and ahead of FOMC minutes, when the focus will be on how easygoing the Fed's going to get. The S&P benchmark is +0.15%. Corn futures are surging after the the USDA lowers its corn forecast. hhgregg is getting battered 30% following its profit warning yesterday. Later: Wholesale Trade
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • HGG

    Shares of hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) continue their freefall, now down 29.1%, following the retailer's...

    Shares of hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) continue their freefall, now down 29.1%, following the retailer's sharp cut in guidance. While RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) and Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) are the obvious sympathy selloff plays - Aaron's (NYSE:AAN), Conn's (NASDAQ:CONN), and even GameStop (NYSE:GME) could also get swept into the fray on concerns about the electronics market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • OMPI

    Premarket gainers: OMPI +8%. OREX +7%. Losers: HGG -30%. OCZ -20%. PSEC -7%. KOF -6%. GG -6%....

    Premarket gainers: OMPI +8%. OREX +7%.
    Losers: HGG -30%. OCZ -20%. PSEC -7%. KOF -6%. GG -6%. BBY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) prices its 21M share secondary offering at $11.15/share (last...

    Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) prices its 21M share secondary offering at $11.15/share (last night's close was $11.90). Shares -6.5% to $11.13 premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) wins a contract to become the exclusive vendor in the Washington DC area for...

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) wins a contract to become the exclusive vendor in the Washington DC area for its in-taxi payment system. Th deal adds advertising revenue potential on top of the sale of the merchandise itself. Shares +3.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • ADM

    Not totally unexpectedly, the USDA lowers its corn forecast 12% to 12.97B Bushels; the projected...

    Not totally unexpectedly, the USDA lowers its corn forecast 12% to 12.97B Bushels; the projected yield is cut 20 bushels/acre to 146 bushels, "reflecting the rapid decline in crop conditions since early June and the latest weather data." Corn prices surge in response.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) new plan is Canada will see the retailer open smaller stores and jump into...

    Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) new plan is Canada will see the retailer open smaller stores and jump into non-core categories online in addition to launching a new price-matching program. The company will open stores in the nation with closer tie-ins to its website and reduce the size to closer to 5K square feet, instead of the 25K-36K square foot behemoths in play right now. BBY -4.4% premarket, after hhgregg guidance cut.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 AM
  • MJN

    "Sorry, we made a mistake," says a Chinese consumer watchdog - or words to that effect - over a...

    "Sorry, we made a mistake," says a Chinese consumer watchdog - or words to that effect - over a test showing that Mead Johnson's (NYSE:MJN) baby formulas contained banned additives. The report sent Mead's shares diving yesterday before they recovered somewhat to close -4.3%. What's Chinese for "class-action suit?"
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 AM | 1 Comment

  • European shares open lower - except Spain - as worries about the global economy weigh on...

    European shares open lower - except Spain - as worries about the global economy weigh on cyclical plays, including basic resources and autos. Euro STOXX 50 -0.3%, London -0.4%, Paris -0.8%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Milan -0.7%, Madrid +0.3%. Spanish 10-year yields -3 bps to 6.78%, Italy -4 bps to 5.91%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 AM
